column1: # OptionalHeaderDataDirectories
| Offset (PE/PE32+) | Size | Field                   | Description                                                                                                                |
| 96/112            | 8    | Export Table            | The export table address and size. For more information see .edata Section (Image Only) .                                  |
| 104/120           | 8    | Import Table            | The import table address and size. For more information
| 112/128           | 8    | Resource Table          | The resource table address and size. For more information
| 120/136           | 8    | Exception Table         | The exception table address and size. For more information
| 128/144           | 8    | Certificate Table       | The attribute certificate table address and size. For more information
column2: see The Attribute Certificate Table (Image Only) . |

column1: | 136/152           | 8    | Base Relocation Table   | The base relocation table address and size. For more information
| 144/160           | 8    | Debug                   | The debug data starting address and size. For more information
| 152/168           | 8    | Architecture            | Reserved
| 160/176           | 8    | Global Ptr              | The RVA of the value to be stored in the global pointer register. The size member of this structure must be set to zero.   |
| 168/184           | 8    | TLS Table               | The thread local storage (TLS) table address and size. For more information
| 176/192           | 8    | Load Config Table       | The load configuration table address and size. For more information
| 184/200           | 8    | Bound Import            | The bound import table address and size.                                                                                   |
| 192/208           | 8    | IAT                     | The import address table address and size. For more information
| 200/216           | 8    | Delay Import Descriptor | The delay import descriptor address and size. For more information
| 208/224           | 8    | CLR Runtime Header      | The CLR runtime header address and size. For more information
| 216/232           | 8    | Reserved
# Description
Each data directory gives the address and size of a table or string that Windows uses. These data directory entries
are all loaded into memory so that the system can use them at run time. A data directory is an 8-byte field
that has the following declaration:
typedef struct _IMAGE_DATA_DIRECTORY {
DWORD   VirtualAddress;
DWORD   Size;
} IMAGE_DATA_DIRECTORY
The first field
column3: is actually the RVA of the table. The RVA is the address of the table relative

column1: to the base address of the image when the table is loaded. The second field gives the size in bytes. The data
directories
column2: which form the last part of the optional header
column3: are listed in the following table.

column1: Note that the number of directories is not fixed. Before looking for a specific directory
NumberOfRvaAndSizes field in the optional header.
Also
column2: do not assume that the RVAs in this table point to the beginning of a section or that the sections that contain

column1: specific tables have specific names.
